title: Authors and Citation
text: Kleanthis Koupidis. Author, maintainer. Nikolaos Koupidis. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Koupidis K, Koupidis N (2025). tidySummaries: Tidy Statistical Summaries Exploratory Data Analysis. R package version 0.1.0, https://kleanthisk10.github.io/tidySummaries.
code: @Manual{,   title = {tidySummaries: Tidy Statistical Summaries for Exploratory Data Analysis},   author = {Kleanthis Koupidis and Nikolaos Koupidis},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://kleanthisk10.github.io/tidySummaries}, }

title: tidySummaries
text: Tidy statistical summaries made simple tidySummaries provides modern extensible set functions descriptive statistics, frequency analysis, significance testing — tidy output. ’s ideal numeric categorical exploratory data analysis, supporting group comparisons, normality checks, console coloring, .

title: tidySummaries
text: Tidy descriptive statisticssummarise_statistics() computes mean, median, standard deviation, variance, skewness, kurtosis, IQR, MAD, CV single tidy tibble. Frequency tablessummarise_frequency() summarizes categorical variables frequency counts, proportions, percentages. Normality group significance testing Automatically perform Shapiro-Wilk tests normality, plus t-tests, Wilcoxon tests, ANOVA, Kruskal-Wallis tests group comparisons. Grouped summariessummarise_group_stats() groups data one variables summarizes selected numeric columns flexibly. Correlation analysissummarise_correlation() computes pairwise correlations (Pearson, Spearman, Kendall) highlights significant results. Boxplot statistics outlier detectionsummarise_boxplot_stats() returns min, Q1, median, Q3, max, range, IQR, detected outliers numeric data. Colored console output significance Statistically significant results automatically highlighted red easy identification. Support vectors, matrices, data frames Functions handle vectors, matrices, tibbles, grouped data frames smoothly. Tidyverse-friendly design Pipeable fully compatible tidyverse workflows. outputs clean tibbles ready analysis visualization.

title: tidySummaries
text: can install development version GitHub: ```r # install.packages(“devtools”) devtools::install_github(“kleanthisk10/tidySummaries”)

title: Select Non-Numeric Columns — select_non_numeric_cols
text: Returns tibble non-numeric columns input, optionally drops rows NAs.

title: Select Non-Numeric Columns — select_non_numeric_cols
code: select_non_numeric_cols(dataset, remove_na = FALSE)

title: Select Non-Numeric Columns — select_non_numeric_cols
text: dataset vector, matrix, data frame, tibble. remove_na Logical. TRUE, rows NA values dropped. Default FALSE.

title: Select Non-Numeric Columns — select_non_numeric_cols
text: tibble non-numeric columns.

title: Select Non-Numeric Columns — select_non_numeric_cols
code: select_non_numeric_cols(iris) #> # A tibble: 150 × 1 #>    Species #>    <fct>   #>  1 setosa  #>  2 setosa  #>  3 setosa  #>  4 setosa  #>  5 setosa  #>  6 setosa  #>  7 setosa  #>  8 setosa  #>  9 setosa  #> 10 setosa  #> # ℹ 140 more rows  df <- tibble::tibble(a = 1:6, b = c("x", "y", NA, NA, "z", NA)) select_non_numeric_cols(df, remove_na = TRUE) #> # A tibble: 3 × 1 #>   b     #>   <chr> #> 1 x     #> 2 y     #> 3 z

title: Select Numeric Columns — select_numeric_cols
text: Returns tibble numeric columns input, optionally drops rows NAs.

title: Select Numeric Columns — select_numeric_cols
code: select_numeric_cols(dataset, remove_na = FALSE)

title: Select Numeric Columns — select_numeric_cols
text: dataset vector, matrix, data frame, tibble. remove_na Logical. TRUE, rows NA values dropped. Default FALSE.

title: Select Numeric Columns — select_numeric_cols
text: tibble numeric columns.

title: Multiple Pattern-Replacement Substitutions — str_replace_many
text: Applies multiple regular expression substitutions character vector specific column data frame. Performs replacements sequentially

title: Multiple Pattern-Replacement Substitutions — str_replace_many
code: str_replace_many(x, pattern, replacement, column = NULL, ...)

title: Multiple Pattern-Replacement Substitutions — str_replace_many
text: x character vector data frame containing text modify. pattern character vector regular expressions match. replacement character vector replacement strings, length `pattern`. column Optional. `x` data frame, name character column apply replacements . ... Additional arguments passed `gsub()`, `ignore.case = TRUE`.

title: Multiple Pattern-Replacement Substitutions — str_replace_many
text: - `x` character vector, returns modified character vector. - `x` data frame, returns data frame specified column modified.

title: Multiple Pattern-Replacement Substitutions — str_replace_many
code: # Example on a character vector text <- c("The cat and the dog", "dog runs fast", "no animals") str_replace_many(text, pattern = c("cat", "dog"), replacement = c("lion", "wolf")) #> [1] "The lion and the wolf" "wolf runs fast"        "no animals"             # Example on a data frame library(tibble) df <- tibble(id = 1:3, text = c("The cat sleeps", "dog runs fast", "no pets")) str_replace_many(df, pattern = c("cat", "dog"), replacement = c("lion", "wolf"), column = "text") #> # A tibble: 3 × 2 #>      id text            #>   <int> <chr>           #> 1     1 The lion sleeps #> 2     2 wolf runs fast  #> 3     3 no pets

what: Summarise Boxplot Statistics with Outliers — summarise_boxplot_stats
title: Summarise Boxplot Statistics with Outliers — summarise_boxplot_stats
text: Computes five-number summary (min, Q1, median, Q3, max), interquartile range (IQR), range, outliers numeric variable data frame numeric vector.

title: Summarise Boxplot Statistics with Outliers — summarise_boxplot_stats
code: summarise_boxplot_stats(x)

title: Summarise Boxplot Statistics with Outliers — summarise_boxplot_stats
text: x numeric vector, matrix, data frame, tibble.

title: Summarise Boxplot Statistics with Outliers — summarise_boxplot_stats
text: tibble columns: `variable`, `min`, `q1`, `median`, `q3`, `max`, `iqr`, `range`, `n_outliers`, `outliers`.

title: Summarise Boxplot Statistics with Outliers — summarise_boxplot_stats
code: summarise_boxplot_stats(iris) #> # A tibble: 4 × 10 #>   variable       min    q1 median    q3   max   iqr range n_outliers outliers  #>   <chr>        <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>      <int> <list>    #> 1 Sepal.Length   4.3   5.1   5.8    6.4   7.9   1.3   3.6          0 <dbl [0]> #> 2 Sepal.Width    2     2.8   3      3.3   4.4   0.5   2.4          4 <dbl [4]> #> 3 Petal.Length   1     1.6   4.35   5.1   6.9   3.5   5.9          0 <dbl [0]> #> 4 Petal.Width    0.1   0.3   1.3    1.8   2.5   1.5   2.4          0 <dbl [0]> summarise_boxplot_stats(iris$Sepal.Width) #> # A tibble: 1 × 10 #>   variable   min    q1 median    q3   max   iqr range n_outliers outliers  #>   <chr>    <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>      <int> <list>    #> 1 value        2   2.8      3   3.3   4.4   0.5   2.4          4 <dbl [4]> summarise_boxplot_stats(data.frame(a = c(rnorm(98), 10, NA))) #> # A tibble: 1 × 10 #>   variable   min     q1 median    q3   max   iqr range n_outliers outliers  #>   <chr>    <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>      <int> <list>    #> 1 a        -2.61 -0.358  0.112 0.625    10 0.983  12.6          9 <dbl [9]>

title: Summarise Coefficient of Variation — summarise_coef_of_variation
text: Calculates coefficient variation (CV = sd / mean) numeric vectors, matrices, data frames, tibbles.

title: Summarise Coefficient of Variation — summarise_coef_of_variation
code: summarise_coef_of_variation(x)

title: Summarise Coefficient of Variation — summarise_coef_of_variation
text: x numeric vector, matrix, data frame, tibble.

title: Summarise Coefficient of Variation — summarise_coef_of_variation
text: tibble: - input one numeric column numeric vector: tibble single value. - input multiple numeric columns: tibble variable names coefficient variation values.

title: Summarise Coefficient of Variation — summarise_coef_of_variation
code: summarise_coef_of_variation(iris) #> # A tibble: 4 × 2 #>   variable     coefficient_of_variation #>   <chr>                           <dbl> #> 1 Sepal.Length                    0.142 #> 2 Sepal.Width                     0.143 #> 3 Petal.Length                    0.470 #> 4 Petal.Width                     0.636 summarise_coef_of_variation(iris$Petal.Length) #> # A tibble: 1 × 1 #>   coefficient_of_variation #>                      <dbl> #> 1                    0.470 summarise_coef_of_variation(data.frame(a = rnorm(100), b = runif(100))) #> # A tibble: 2 × 2 #>   variable coefficient_of_variation #>   <chr>                       <dbl> #> 1 a                           9.53  #> 2 b                           0.596

what: Summarise Correlation Matrix with Optional Significance Tests — summarise_correlation
title: Summarise Correlation Matrix with Optional Significance Tests — summarise_correlation
text: Computes correlations numeric variables data frame, two vectors. Optionally tests statistical significance (p-value)

title: Summarise Correlation Matrix with Optional Significance Tests — summarise_correlation
code: summarise_correlation(   x,   y = NULL,   method = c("pearson", "kendall", "spearman"),   cor_test = FALSE )

title: Summarise Correlation Matrix with Optional Significance Tests — summarise_correlation
text: x numeric vector, matrix, data frame, tibble. y Optional. second numeric vector, matrix, data frame (dimensions `x`). method Character. One "pearson" (default), "kendall", "spearman". cor_test Logical. TRUE, uses `cor.test()` includes p-values. FALSE, uses `cor()` .

title: Summarise Correlation Matrix with Optional Significance Tests — summarise_correlation
text: tibble variables, correlations, optionally p-values. Significant results (p < 0.05) printed red console.

title: Summarise Correlation Matrix with Optional Significance Tests — summarise_correlation
code: summarise_correlation(iris) #> # A tibble: 6 × 3 #>   var1         var2         correlation #>   <chr>        <chr>              <dbl> #> 1 Sepal.Length Sepal.Width       -0.118 #> 2 Sepal.Length Petal.Length       0.872 #> 3 Sepal.Length Petal.Width        0.818 #> 4 Sepal.Width  Petal.Length      -0.428 #> 5 Sepal.Width  Petal.Width       -0.366 #> 6 Petal.Length Petal.Width        0.963 summarise_correlation(iris$Sepal.Length, iris$Petal.Length, cor_test = TRUE) #> # A tibble: 1 × 4 #>   var1  var2  correlation p_value #>   <chr> <chr>       <dbl> <chr>   #> 1 x     y           0.872 0.000*

title: Summarise Frequency Table — summarise_frequency
text: Computes frequency relative frequency (percentage) factor character variables data frame vector.

title: Summarise Frequency Table — summarise_frequency
code: summarise_frequency(   data,   select = NULL,   as_percent = FALSE,   sort_by = NULL,   top_n = Inf )

title: Summarise Frequency Table — summarise_frequency
text: data character/factor vector, data frame/tibble. select Optional. One variable names compute frequencies . NULL, factor/character columns used. as_percent Logical. TRUE, relative frequencies returned percentages (%). Default FALSE (proportions). sort_by Optional. "N", sorts frequency; "group", sorts alphabetically; "%N" (as_percent = TRUE). Default sorting. top_n Integer. Show top N values

title: Summarise Frequency Table — summarise_frequency
text: tibble following columns: variable name variable. group group/category values variable. N count (frequency) group. %N proportion percentage group.

title: Summarise Frequency Table — summarise_frequency
code: summarise_frequency(iris, select = "Species") #> # A tibble: 3 × 4 #>   variable group          N `%N`        #>   <chr>    <chr>      <int> <table[1d]> #> 1 Species  setosa        50 0.3333      #> 2 Species  versicolor    50 0.3333      #> 3 Species  virginica     50 0.3333      summarise_frequency(iris, as_percent = TRUE, sort_by = "N", top_n = 2) #> # A tibble: 2 × 4 #>   variable group          N `%N`   #>   <chr>    <chr>      <int> <chr>  #> 1 Species  setosa        50 33.33% #> 2 Species  versicolor    50 33.33% summarise_frequency(data.frame(group = c("A", "A", "B", "C", "A")), as_percent = TRUE) #> # A tibble: 3 × 4 #>   variable group     N `%N`   #>   <chr>    <chr> <int> <chr>  #> 1 group    A         3 60.00% #> 2 group    B         1 20.00% #> 3 group    C         1 20.00%

title: Summarize Grouped Statistics — summarise_group_stats
text: Groups data frame one variables summarizes selected numeric columns using basic statistic functions. Handles missing values replacement zero removal rows.

title: Summarize Grouped Statistics — summarise_group_stats
code: summarise_group_stats(   df,   group_var,   values,   m_functions = c("mean", "sd", "length"),   replace_na = FALSE,   remove_na = FALSE )

title: Summarize Grouped Statistics — summarise_group_stats
text: df data frame tibble containing data. group_var character vector column names group . values character vector numeric column names summarize. m_functions character vector functions apply (e.g., "mean", "sd", "length"). Default c("mean", "sd", "length"). replace_na Logical. TRUE, missing values numeric columns replaced 0. Default FALSE. remove_na Logical. TRUE, rows missing values group value columns removed. Default FALSE.

title: Summarize Grouped Statistics — summarise_group_stats
text: tibble grouped summarized results.

title: Summarize Grouped Statistics — summarise_group_stats
code: summarise_group_stats(iris, group_var = "Species",  values = c("Sepal.Length", "Petal.Width")) #> # A tibble: 3 × 7 #>   Species Sepal.Length_mean Sepal.Length_sd Sepal.Length_length Petal.Width_mean #>   <fct>               <dbl>           <dbl>               <int>            <dbl> #> 1 setosa               5.01           0.352                  50            0.246 #> 2 versic…              5.94           0.516                  50            1.33  #> 3 virgin…              6.59           0.636                  50            2.03  #> # ℹ 2 more variables: Petal.Width_sd <dbl>, Petal.Width_length <int> summarise_group_stats(mtcars,  group_var = c("cyl", "gear"),  values = c("mpg", "hp"), remove_na = TRUE) #> # A tibble: 8 × 8 #>     cyl  gear mpg_mean mpg_sd mpg_length hp_mean hp_sd hp_length #>   <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl>  <dbl>      <int>   <dbl> <dbl>     <int> #> 1     4     3     21.5 NA              1     97  NA            1 #> 2     4     4     26.9  4.81           8     76  20.1          8 #> 3     4     5     28.2  3.11           2    102  15.6          2 #> 4     6     3     19.8  2.33           2    108.  3.54         2 #> 5     6     4     19.8  1.55           4    116.  7.51         4 #> 6     6     5     19.7 NA              1    175  NA            1 #> 7     8     3     15.0  2.77          12    194. 33.4         12 #> 8     8     5     15.4  0.566          2    300. 50.2          2

title: Summarise Kurtosis — summarise_kurtosis
text: Calculates kurtosis (default: **excess kurtosis**) numeric vectors, matrices, data frames, tibbles. Supports "standard" "unbiased" methods optionally returns **raw kurtosis**.

title: Summarise Kurtosis — summarise_kurtosis
code: summarise_kurtosis(x, method = c("standard", "unbiased"), excess = TRUE)

title: Summarise Kurtosis — summarise_kurtosis
text: x numeric vector, matrix, data frame, tibble. method Character. Method kurtosis calculation: `"standard"` (default) `"unbiased"`. excess Logical. TRUE (default), returns **excess kurtosis** (minus 3); FALSE, returns **raw kurtosis**.

title: Summarise Kurtosis — summarise_kurtosis
text: tibble: - input one numeric column (vector), single-row tibble. - input multiple numeric columns, tibble variable names kurtosis values.

title: Summarise Kurtosis — summarise_kurtosis
code: summarise_kurtosis(iris) #> # A tibble: 4 × 2 #>   variable     kurtosis #>   <chr>           <dbl> #> 1 Sepal.Length   -0.606 #> 2 Sepal.Width     0.139 #> 3 Petal.Length   -1.42  #> 4 Petal.Width    -1.36  summarise_kurtosis(iris, method = "unbiased") #> # A tibble: 4 × 2 #>   variable     kurtosis #>   <chr>           <dbl> #> 1 Sepal.Length    -3.04 #> 2 Sepal.Width     -3.04 #> 3 Petal.Length    -3.05 #> 4 Petal.Width     -3.05 summarise_kurtosis(iris, excess = FALSE)  # Raw kurtosis #> # A tibble: 4 × 2 #>   variable     kurtosis #>   <chr>           <dbl> #> 1 Sepal.Length     2.39 #> 2 Sepal.Width      3.14 #> 3 Petal.Length     1.58 #> 4 Petal.Width      1.64 summarise_kurtosis(iris$Sepal.Width) #> # A tibble: 1 × 1 #>   kurtosis #>      <dbl> #> 1    0.139

title: Summarise Skewness — summarise_skewness
text: Calculates skewness numeric vectors, matrices, data frames, tibbles using Pearson’s moment coefficient.

title: Summarise Skewness — summarise_skewness
code: summarise_skewness(x)

title: Summarise Skewness — summarise_skewness
text: x numeric vector, matrix, data frame, tibble.

title: Summarise Skewness — summarise_skewness
text: tibble: - input one numeric column numeric vector: tibble single value. - input multiple numeric columns: tibble variable names skewness values.

title: Summarise Skewness — summarise_skewness
code: summarise_skewness(iris) #> # A tibble: 4 × 2 #>   variable     skewness #>   <chr>           <dbl> #> 1 Sepal.Length    0.309 #> 2 Sepal.Width     0.313 #> 3 Petal.Length   -0.269 #> 4 Petal.Width    -0.101 summarise_skewness(as.vector(iris$Sepal.Width)) #> # A tibble: 1 × 1 #>   skewness #>      <dbl> #> 1    0.313 summarise_skewness(data.frame(a = rnorm(100), b = rgamma(100, 2))) #> # A tibble: 2 × 2 #>   variable skewness #>   <chr>       <dbl> #> 1 a          0.0209 #> 2 b          1.01

what: Summarise Descriptive Statistics with Optional Testing — summarise_statistics
title: Summarise Descriptive Statistics with Optional Testing — summarise_statistics
text: Computes descriptive statistics numeric data. Optionally groups variable includes Shapiro-Wilk group significance testing. Can color console output significant differences.

title: Summarise Descriptive Statistics with Optional Testing — summarise_statistics
code: summarise_statistics(   data,   group_var = NULL,   normality_test = FALSE,   group_test = FALSE,   show_colors = TRUE )

title: Summarise Descriptive Statistics with Optional Testing — summarise_statistics
text: data numeric vector, matrix, data frame. group_var Optional. character name grouping variable. normality_test Logical. TRUE, performs Shapiro-Wilk test normality. group_test Logical. TRUE `group_var` set, performs group-wise significance tests (t-test, ANOVA, etc.). show_colors Logical. TRUE `group_test` TRUE, prints colored console output significant group results. Default TRUE.

title: Summarise Descriptive Statistics with Optional Testing — summarise_statistics
text: tibble descriptive statistics optional test results per numeric variable.

title: Summarise Descriptive Statistics with Optional Testing — summarise_statistics
code: summarise_statistics(iris, group_var = "Species", group_test = TRUE) #>  #> Significance Test Summary: #> # A tibble: 12 × 4 #> # Groups:   Species [3] #>    Species    variable     group_test_p_value      group_test_result             #>    <fct>      <chr>        <chr>                   <chr>                         #>  1 setosa     Sepal.Length "\u001b[31m0\u001b[39m" "\u001b[31msignificant diffe… #>  2 setosa     Sepal.Width  "\u001b[31m0\u001b[39m" "\u001b[31msignificant diffe… #>  3 setosa     Petal.Length "\u001b[31m0\u001b[39m" "\u001b[31msignificant diffe… #>  4 setosa     Petal.Width  "\u001b[31m0\u001b[39m" "\u001b[31msignificant diffe… #>  5 versicolor Sepal.Length "\u001b[31m0\u001b[39m" "\u001b[31msignificant diffe… #>  6 versicolor Sepal.Width  "\u001b[31m0\u001b[39m" "\u001b[31msignificant diffe… #>  7 versicolor Petal.Length "\u001b[31m0\u001b[39m" "\u001b[31msignificant diffe… #>  8 versicolor Petal.Width  "\u001b[31m0\u001b[39m" "\u001b[31msignificant diffe… #>  9 virginica  Sepal.Length "\u001b[31m0\u001b[39m" "\u001b[31msignificant diffe… #> 10 virginica  Sepal.Width  "\u001b[31m0\u001b[39m" "\u001b[31msignificant diffe… #> 11 virginica  Petal.Length "\u001b[31m0\u001b[39m" "\u001b[31msignificant diffe… #> 12 virginica  Petal.Width  "\u001b[31m0\u001b[39m" "\u001b[31msignificant diffe… #> # A tibble: 12 × 20 #> # Groups:   Species [3] #>    Species    variable   min    q1 median    q3   max range   iqr  mean variance #>    <fct>      <chr>    <dbl> <dbl>  <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl> #>  1 setosa     Sepal.L…   4.3  4.8    5     5.2    5.8   1.5 0.400 5.01    0.124  #>  2 setosa     Sepal.W…   2.3  3.2    3.4   3.68   4.4   2.1 0.475 3.43    0.144  #>  3 setosa     Petal.L…   1    1.4    1.5   1.58   1.9   0.9 0.175 1.46    0.0302 #>  4 setosa     Petal.W…   0.1  0.2    0.2   0.3    0.6   0.5 0.1   0.246   0.0111 #>  5 versicolor Sepal.L…   4.9  5.6    5.9   6.3    7     2.1 0.7   5.94    0.266  #>  6 versicolor Sepal.W…   2    2.52   2.8   3      3.4   1.4 0.475 2.77    0.0985 #>  7 versicolor Petal.L…   3    4      4.35  4.6    5.1   2.1 0.600 4.26    0.221  #>  8 versicolor Petal.W…   1    1.2    1.3   1.5    1.8   0.8 0.3   1.33    0.0391 #>  9 virginica  Sepal.L…   4.9  6.22   6.5   6.9    7.9   3   0.675 6.59    0.404  #> 10 virginica  Sepal.W…   2.2  2.8    3     3.18   3.8   1.6 0.375 2.97    0.104  #> 11 virginica  Petal.L…   4.5  5.1    5.55  5.88   6.9   2.4 0.775 5.55    0.305  #> 12 virginica  Petal.W…   1.4  1.8    2     2.3    2.5   1.1 0.5   2.03    0.0754 #> # ℹ 9 more variables: sd <dbl>, cv <dbl>, mad <dbl>, skewness <dbl>, #> #   kurtosis <dbl>, normality_p_value <dbl>, normality_result <chr>, #> #   group_test_p_value <dbl>, group_test_result <chr>
